summary: This is a sworn declaration by an unnamed declarant submitted in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case. The declarant, a former finance professional, provides personal recollections about a woman he has known since the 1990s, describing her character, past behavior, and recent conversations about the Maxwell trial and financial benefits from the Epstein estate. The document appears to be an attempt to cast doubt on the credibility of a potential witness or victim.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case S2 20 Cr. 330. The declarant discusses the upcoming trial against her and the woman's efforts to blame her.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject that came up in a conversation with the woman, who claimed to be getting money from his estate.

persons.name: Bill Wyman
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the celebrities the woman allegedly bragged about sleeping with.

connections.description: The declarant states the woman is trying to put blame for past indiscretions onto Ghislaine Maxwell in the context of the trial.
The woman told the declarant she was getting big money from the Epstein estate.
The declarant has known the woman since the mid-1990s, met her many times in London, and recently had phone conversations with her about the Maxwell trial.

events.title: Chance Meeting on Plane
events.description: The declarant last saw the woman on a plane leg to Los Angeles. She waved him down, they chatted, and she made a comment about Jeffrey Epstein ('it fell right into my lap').

events.title: Phone Conversations About Maxwell Trial
events.description: After the plane meeting, the woman called the declarant from Los Angeles multiple times. She discussed getting money from the Epstein estate, the strengthening case against Ghislaine Maxwell, and her need to 'get her story straight' and blame Maxwell.

events.title: Execution of Declaration
events.description: The declarant signed and executed this sworn declaration under penalty of perjury.

keyFacts: The declarant describes a woman he has known since the 1990s as a frequent fabricator, 'coke head,' and social climber who bragged about sleeping with celebrities.
The woman allegedly told the declarant she was 'getting big money from the Epstein estate' in the context of the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The declarant believes the woman's story of abuse was 'exaggerated even fabricated' and that she was using the trial to excuse her past indiscretions and portray herself as a victim.
The woman reportedly stated the case against Maxwell was getting stronger because 'the women in the case against her were strengthening their stories.'
This declaration appears to be a character attack on a potential witness or victim, submitted by the defense or a third party to undermine her credibility.
